data.title: Did Eminem Really Make MGK Give Up Rapping?

data.text:
Colson Baker, better referred to as Machine Gun Kelly, or MGK, is an American rapper, singer, and actor who rose to repute within the early 2010s. Widely known for his rap profession, MGK grew up taking note of famous acts akin to DMX and his "idol" Eminem. MGK has released 5 studio albums, 4 of which are rap albums. His most recent unencumber is a pop-punk album, produced through blink-182 drummer Travis Barker.

Related: Travis Barker Reportedly Bought A Ring For Kourtney Kardashian

Grammy and Oscar winning rapper Eminem, given title Marshall Mathers, has been making music for the reason that late '90s, and is thought of as by way of many to be one of the greatest rappers of all time. The two rappers have famously, or slightly infamously, feuded for years, leaving some to wonder if MGK hand over rapping due to his dispute with the mononymous rapper. Here's what we know about their feud and MGK's pop-punk album, Tickets to My Downfall.

7 MGK Tweets About Eminem's Daughter

This feud started, unwittingly, again in 2012 when Machine Gun Kelly tweeted about Eminem's daughter, commenting on her look. The tweet read: "I have to say, she is hot as f***, in the most respectful way possible cuz Em is king." Years later, consistent with Eminem, he went down a "wormhole on YouTube" and discovered the tweet, igniting a feud between the 2 musicians.

6 Eminem Releases a Diss Track

Several years after Machine Gun Kelly posted his tweet, 6 to be exact, Eminem launched a diss observe entitled "Not Alike" calling out Machine Gun Kelly for the tweet about his daughter, as he found it inappropriate. After reading it for the primary time all those years later, the tweet afflicted Eminem, and when requested about it he defined his frustration and reason for the next diss, calling it "petty" and claiming to not care about MGK's occupation.

5 MGK Releases a Diss Track

Machine Gun Kelly launched an EP known as "Binge," which incorporated his own diss observe "Rap Devil" based on Eminem's, the name an immediate connection with Eminem's tune "Rap God." MGK expressed his confusion over his releasing of a diss track centered on one thing he said 6 years in the past, and spent the rest of the track airing his problems with the Detroit native. MGK found the diss track troubling for quite a lot of causes, but as he would later divulge, he used to be disappointed about being entangled in a feud with somebody he as soon as revered as an idol.

Related: Here's Why Eminem Watched His Daughter's Homecoming Ceremony From A Different Room

4 Eminem Releases Another Diss Track

After "Rap Devil" was once released, Eminem launched but another diss track geared toward Machine Gun Kelly, known as "Killshot," which spurred reaction posts from fans across the internet. Fans took facets in the feud, some thanking MGK for "sacrificing his career" so they may have some other Eminem diss observe, and others commending MGK for no longer only having the courage to unlock an Eminem diss monitor, but having the talent to again up his claims. After listening to Eminem's 2d diss observe, MGK wrote a response but never released it. He says he isn't over their feud, however he is completed liberating diss tracks.

3 MGK Releases Hotel Diablo

In 2019, MGK dropped his fourth studio album, Hotel Diablo. The album used to be gained with lack of vital acclaim, which Machine Gun Kelly attributed to its free up "coming off the tail-end of that infamous beef." MGK described his album as "flawless front to back," and "a hint at the evolution of how [he] went into a pop-punk album" in an interview with Dave Franco for Interview mag.

Related: Megan Fox Promotes Her Man MGK's Deluxe Album With Song 'Body Bag' Playing

2 MGK's Single "I Think I'm OKAY"

https://www.instagram.com/p/CPa8VwoJxuS/

The album's most well liked unmarried "I Think I'm OKAY" is decidedly pop-punk and includes a singing MGK slightly than rapping. The track is a collaboration with MGK's shut pals Travis Barker and British pop-punk singer Yungblud. The 3 have collaborated as duos and trios a number of occasions, growing most commonly pop-punk paintings. Yungblud and Machine Gun Kelly mentioned of the Hotel Diablo music, "it felt like the song that we both wish we wrote when we were twelve" in an interview with Audacy. Looking back, lovers can see this music used to be a precursor to the music MGK used to be going to release.

1 MGK Drops Tickets to My Downfall

Just over a 12 months after freeing Hotel Diablo, Machine Gun Kelly made a whole genre shift from his four previous albums and released a bonafide pop-punk album, a complete style shift from his four earlier studio albums. A critical and industrial luck, this used to be MGK's first album to not simplest succeed in, however debut at, #1 at the Billboard 200 chart.

Although some speculate Eminem driven MGK to switch from rap to pop-punk, MGK has made it transparent he shifted on his personal, telling NME he's played guitar since he used to be a child and was once a member of a pop-punk band as a teen. He mentions, too, "a lead singer with a guitar-playing four-chord pop-punk" is "a missing link in this current day." Tickets to My Downfall confirmed enthusiasts MGK plans to fill that void.
